title: Ticket #1881: CondorPlatform wrong in all 7.5.5 binaries
description:
In trying to build a 7.5.5 Condor on Solaris 10 X86/64, I was unable to get the version string correct. I specified -DPLATFORM:STRING=x86_64_sol_5.10 to cmake in configuring my build, yet it yielded this: 

-bash-3.00$ ident condor_version
condor_version:
     $CondorVersion: %d.%d.%d %s %d %d $
     $CondorVersion: 7.5.5 Jan 28 2011 BuildID: UW_development $
     $CondorPlatform: I386-SUNOS_x86_64_sol_5.10 $
-bash-3.00$ ./condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.5.5 Jan 28 2011 BuildID: UW_development $
$CondorPlatform: I386-SUNOS_x86_64_sol_5.10 $

In investigating further, I found this in the 7.5.5 released RHAP 5 binary: 

nleroy@tonic% ident condor-7.5.5-x86_64_rhap_5-stripped/bin/condor_version
condor-7.5.5-x86_64_rhap_5-stripped/bin/condor_version:
     $CondorPlatform: X86_64-LINUX_x86_64_rhap_5 $
     $CondorVersion: 7.5.5 Jan 26 2011 BuildID: 308936 $
     $CondorVersion: %d.%d.%d %s %d %d $
     $GCBBuildDate: Jan 26 2011 $
     $GCBVersion: 1.5.0 $
remarks:
2011-Feb-01 16:20:02 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.
check_ins: 2011-Jan-28 18:23   Check-in [20177]: Modified the glue and cmake configure logic to make the CondorPlatform string match the name used in the tarballs. #1881 (By Nick LeRoy )
creator: nleroy
